comment:
This device works pretty good as long as it's up your butt or in your shirt pocket. No range at all. I was 20 ft away from this device in another room and could not connect to it. The same issue for other family members in other rooms of the house. Kept it for a couple of days to give it a fair chance. The limited range of this device is very poor. I imagine you could connect 10 devices to this, if it were five people holding two devices standing shoulder to shoulder in a circle!
I know now why they charged me a $45 restocking Fee, because many people are trying to return them. The almost 40% restocking cost is to deter you to even return it.

I bought this for a temporary internet connection.
I live in the Los Angeles, County and always got a strong signal. 
Not good for gaming, streaming, watching Netflix or youtube you should probably just install regular internet at home. This will cost way more to run.. for example $6 per GB
Works great for checking email and internet sleuthing. 
The battery power depends on usage but for now I can probably get 10-12 hours of battery power.
Customer service has been helpful.
 I reached out through the online chat messenger
 and got help within minutes.
There was some trouble shooting and resetting that came up but they walk you through it .
.
Good little wifi box, will never have to worry about searching for a signal again.

I love this portable WiFi device. It is perfect for travel or even when I am working in my backyard - my new work from home office. It is easy to set up using the Solis App. I use the pay-per-day option for data so that I am only paying when I need to use it. It saves me money when I travel internationally too. I no longer need to purchase my cell service's international travel plan. The Solis connect up to 10 devices so in addition to my laptop I use it with my phone and then use WiFi calling. It is so light and portable I just stick in my bag or back pocket.

I bought the Solis Lite with expectations that were pretty tragic. I expected the quality to be about cell phone wifi hot spot level, which I hadn't realize was so lousy until I tried to actually stream music through it. The Solis Lite came into my life and legitimately I was blown away by how great it functions. I've had zero connectivity issues in western Massachusetts, USA, and the speed has been greater than I had hoped, and stable. I've recommended this product to a few of my friends who are now probably sick of me raving about it. Thank you, Skyroam, for making such a great little device and providing this service!

I bought my Skyroam Solis to take with me on a cruise. Cruise ship wifi is extremely expensive! We were able to use it in all the ports on our Panama Canal cruise from Vancouver to Fort Lauderdale. We could even do Facebook updates all the way through the canal. Fantastic! No more looking for free wifi after leaving the ship. When at home or traveling, I take it with me when hiking or even when doing chores around town. Wifi is always with me in my car. I can’t say enough about Customer Service. They are awesome! I’ve demonstrated how easy to use this device is multiple times. I should get a commission! Great Product!

This is my second Skyroam I have purchased. I was really happy with the new smaller design however the device and service has really let me down.
I have only used the unit 3 times since I purchased it once in Bucharest once in Warsaw where I simply could not connect to the service. This was poor but I have had trouble connecting other devices in those countries 
But the biggest failure was in HK where I connected really easy but the Unlimited day Pass was so slow after the first 30 mins it was unusable. I was tempted to purchase unlimited monthly passes but I’m so worried that the service will be so slow it will not be worth it.

Massive disappointment, Can I return It?

I have been very disappointed with my SkyRoam. I bought it specifically to make WiFi calls and send emails for work while traveling internationally. The service continues to be extremely unreliable despite people around me being able to connect to and use the cellular network for the same activities (and more) than what I am trying to use it for. Support was working for a bit, but now my chat with support refuses to work whenever I don’t have WiFi for calls (even though I have enough WiFi to stream music). I emailed support via the website yesterday to express my frustration problems and have yet to hear from anyone. Please do yourself a favor and look at other products.

This works well but only in a T-Mobile or AT&T cellular area. Could not get it to connect in my town (Verizon area) until I drove about ten miles outside of where I live. Once it connected it worked fine and did what it is suppose to do. Worked with their customer support on live chat and first he said it wouldnt work in a Verizon area and then few minutes later said it should still connect to any tower. He said he reset something on his end and said to power down and wait. Still didnt help. Tried mutiple times. Dont try their emal. They say they can help then tell you to use live chat after a couple emails. I selected yes for would I recommend but it depends where you live.

I thinkg Solis Lite wifi service is terrible. 

I've been using the service for about six weeks, and have already experienced dozens of dropped connections, which is more dropped connections than I've experience in one year using Solis 1, and more drop connections that I've experience with several other wifi services combined, over the past 13 years. 

Sometimes I'm fully connected to wifi with 5 bars, but the communication tower isn't responding, so I'm not able to navigate the internet. I have to shut down my PC, shut down the wifi device and reboot. 

If I had not been forced to switch from Solis 1 to solis Lite 5g, I wouldn't be using Solis Lite.

The service is not stable.

I live near a fairly trafficked area with cars. There is also a brewery nearby. Within two hours of running this little devil my room smells great, and I can take deep easy breaths in with no raspy feeling that dusty and pollen gives me. Being that I have a small canine the room also always has a smell of dog. Right now my room smells like fresh air you get a whiff of on the way to the ocean, before the salt, but in between the city smog and the clean breeze of the coast. Very small and light weight. I think my favorite part is there is no superfluous options, though I'd of enjoyed having a timer to set it so it would turn off after an hour of being out of the house.

I need dehumidifier since my I have asthmatic reaction to humid air. I have chosen this unit because of combination of features, air dehumidifier and purifier in one. I left my place for about a week with machine on, accidentally. I did not worry a lot since it was said that it should automatically shut off at water tank overflow. Well, when I came back the overflow light was on, but machine was still running; all counter space was flooded. Huge disappointment!

I live in the Pacific Northwest and after leaving one of my cars parked outside for a couple months without driving it I noticed that mold was growing on the fabric. I put a digital thermometer/humidity meter in the car with the dehumidifier running. After a day 2 cups of water were pulled out of the air in the vehicle. I emptied it a few more times with less water each day over a week and now the humidity is down to a level where mold will not grow. It would also be great for a gun safe since it is quite small but does pull a remarkable amount of moisture from the air for it's size. I'm not sure how well it would work for a whole room since I only used it in a small space but my experience so far has been positive.

I intentionally bought this air purifier/ dehumidifier, because I was hoping it would make noise (in addition to it purifying the air and draining water of course). I work grave shifts at my job, and I prefer to have a more natural sounding white noise other than what a smart phone app can provide while I'm sleeping during the day. It actually wasn't as loud as I was hoping. I ended up switching it out for the one in my daughter's room, and it seems to work great! It seems to work well in the amount of space, is easy to use, and makes enough noise to be her sound machine without being overwhelming during the night. If you are looking for one that is completely silent, however, this maybe isn't the one for you.

I suppose it works as advertised, but it doesn't pull water out fast enough to change the humidity in our bedroom more than a few points from ambient. In other words, if relative humidity outside is 60%, the lowest this unit will bring RH in a room is about 55%. If you plan to use it in a room with a draft, or any room bigger than a small bedroom, you will want a bigger /faster drying unit.

The purifier/dehumifier arrives 4 days earlier than the expected delivery date. Excited! 
The design is very beautiful and modern. The control panel is touch sensor and can be controlled by your smartphone. This is very nice and convenient. 
The noise isn't loud. 
The size is appropriate, not too small, not too big. It fits perfectly in my bed room. 
The value and the quality is amazing!!

This is a great little unit! I moved into a 2 bedroom apartment that was so humid it was uncomfortable. I didn't want to spend a ton of money or get a large dehumidifier due to limited space and because winter will be here soon so I thought I would give this one a try and would pass it on to my brother for use in his RV if my place was too big for it to handle. I knew it wasn't really built to handle an entire apartment so I wasn't expecting it to be perfect but it has made a measurable improvement and is the perfect size for my needs. It's super quiet and reliably shuts itself off when full which was also important to me. Rather than buying a large unit I would recommend starting with one of these and adding a second one later if one isn't enough.

Ran this in the living room (~400 SQ FT) don't seem to notice much differences. Was about to return it, but my wife placed it in the bed room the other night (~150 SQ FT), I noticed the difference in air quality at night. Will keep it for now and see.

I accidentally fried the innards when I plugged a high-powered oil heater into the same outlet as this device. It tried to keep going but just couldn't.
One week later I had a new device and it is now working perfectly on a separate outlet from the heater. All is good. 
I've noticed a decrease of humidity from average 60's to 50's and lower when this is in working order. I empty it every 3 or 4 days. I'm breathing much better now that's back in place.
Kudos to the customer service team for making the return and inspection an easy and pleasant process.

Pros: 1) Small and lightweight = portable and can take into any room easily. 2) 2 in 1 function means one less machine to buy. 3) Does what it advertised to do.  Cons: 1. Small means it's only good to use in smaller rooms 2. Filter is non-washable 3. Water tank is 1 litre (i have to dump out once every 7-10 days)
it's a pretty good phone in my opinion I would recommend this to a friend hell even a stranger
Dear Apple team at this site have 1 time payment option avaliable
Easy to set up. Good to have a visual of EKG and to know it can be shared. Gives a sense of security.

This little device is amazing! It monitors your heart and see your heart beat on the Kardia app! It also gives you your pulse rate and will let you know if your heart is beating too fast, or if there is an irregularity. Super easy to use. Just put two fingers from each hand on the little device and press start. Only takes 30 seconds. You can set it up to send results straight to your doctor, too!

I am 57, an age that I take seriously the condition of my heart. This addition to my self-health check-ups became very important. I love the quality and fast certified diagnosis. A must have along with the Blood Pressure check. The App is very simple, yet professionally done.

I have both the KardiaMobile (Single-Lead) and KardiaMobile 6L (6-Lead).  I keep the 6L at home and the KardiaMobile in my desk at work.  Both devices give me the same nature of results; I can't tell whether the 6L is more accurate or more sensitive, they both seem to detect the same kinds of irrythmias.  The KardiaMobile is easy to use at work, it just takes a few seconds, using two fingers, at your desk.  The KardiaMobile came with a felt carrying case with magnetic closure, included in the box.  At first I didn't quite understand how the KardiaMobile works, it doesn't use bluetooth it uses some sort of high frequency audio to communicate with your cellphone app.  So your cellphone has to be nearby and the microphone can't be hidden from the KardiaMobile, they have to be fairly close to each other and sort of pointing at each other, then they can communicate just fine. I find the real-time results so useful to understand what's going on.  This is so much more valuable than an annual check-up or a one-day Holter Test.

The Kardia Mobile Single is a fantastic idea.  Setup was easy and the instructions are easy.  Unfortunately using the pads has been extremely difficult to get a good reading.  I've tried several times over the week that I've had it and still did not get a stable graft.  My first try told me to move because of interference.  I wasn't anywhere near any other electronics or transformers.  My next try in the same location worked, but the graft was all over the place.  Tried all the suggestions given by the company online and have yet to get a clean graft.  The quality of the device is good, but you have to pay extra if you want a carrying case.

As a former AFib sufferer, this device has proven to be an invaluable tool for monitoring and detecting both normal and irregular heart rhythms.  The associated Kardia iPhone app records measurement results locally which enables the information to be conveniently presented to your cardiologist or GP during routine visits.  An optional subscription facilitates storing of the EKG measurements in the cloud.  The only criticism, in terms of usage, is that a firm/heavy pressure must be applied and maintained to the electrodes during the 60 second measurement period.  Placing the device on a table or firm surface is mandatory to avoid miss-reads.
Gf has issues with the electrodes that her cardologist uses so he recomended this device works very well she is able to message her results straight to her doc would recomend. Size of a cracker.
They tell you the battery can be replaced but that is not true for certain models. Better tech support needed. Not all models have replaceable batteries

Product is a great idea, but the electrode piece is too small to comfortably just sit and place your fingers on, and too easily moved to interfere with getting a good ekg. I have a prosthetic aortic valve and I’ve yet to get a good ekg from it since purchase. All I get is that my readings have too much electrical interference no matter where I sit to do
This. The idea was to purchase this device and use it to create EKGs and send them to my cardiologist on a weekly basis, but with no readable ekgs that all went out the window. My advice is stay away from this device until they improve the size and stability of the electrode piece of the equipment.

The AliveCor is truly excellent.  

Was introduced to it by my cardiac surgeon after my first cardiac ablation to monitor myself.  Six months after being weaned off the Amiodarone, the unit picked up another AFIB.  Of course it was a weekend, and only the on call cardiologist was available, but here was the magic...  He said...

"Ok...  relax your arms to get a clean strip and TEXT it to me..."   Don't come to the office, don't go to the ER, just relax your arms, get and clean reading and TEXT it to me....  Now that is the future of medicine.

I've taken over a thousand readings with my AliveCor over the past 4 years.  Best investment I ever made.

This is a cool little unit. It is extremely light and easy to travel with...I am in public safety and am constantly needing to be near a computer but also in the field at the same time...this thing solved that for me! I can now just scan documents right to my phone or to the cloud and keep it moving! The setup was extremely easy.... pretty much plug and play..only needed to download a couple things from the links listed in the instruction manual....simple and was working within 5 minutes from first opening the box! The scan quality has been decent enough so far...it's not high def quality but way better than I even expected from a portable scanner. Only cons I have discovered so far is the scanner is so light that it feels really cheap....I don't have any doubt that if I were to accidentally drop it or even just have it in a backpack without a protective case....this thing would crush and break VERY easily. But I somewhat expected that in a portable scanner. This is a review for the RapidReceipt RR-60 Mobile Receipt Scanner that I received free of charge to do a beta test and review!

The Epson Rapid Receipt RR-60 is an exceptionally good receipt and document scanner.  It is a small, fast, lightweight, and portable scanner designed for managing receipts/invoices.  It can scan receipts, business cards, and PDF documents fast and effortlessly.  Setup and installation were completed within minutes.  I just attached the USB cable to scanner and my Surface Pro and downloaded the necessary software and drivers from the Epson website.  The instructions were quite simple to follow.  I am able scan documents and categorize them into applicable folders in a specified location.  I have saved in Google drive, my documents’ folder on my computer and even emailed a few documents using the software.  Scanned items can be saved or exported.  This scanner has made storing my personal documents especially old tax return information a breeze.  Gone are days of storing piles of receipts and documents.  It is a very efficient scanner, and I am very pleased with its capabilities.  So far, I have no complaints.  I would really recommend it for anyone needing to organize paperwork whether personal or business.  This is a review for the RapidReceipt RR-60 Mobile Receipt Scanner that I received free of charge to do a beta test and review.

I have to start by saying, I absolutely love the RapidReceipt RR-60! It’s so sleek and small that it takes no room at all on my desk. I upload a lot of receipts and documents daily and would have to use my bulky printer to scan then upload into my email and send to appropriate receiver. Lots of times they were everywhere in my email, leaving me spending unnecessary times locating them. This little handy scanner does it all in a matter of seconds and neatly files them all in one place. I’m not sure how I’ve survived all this time without this scanner. I’m so thankful to of had the opportunity to receive this scanner to test. “This is a review for the RapidReceipt RR-60 Mobile Receipt Scanner that I received free of charge to do a beta test and review.”

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Set up is simple. Plug in the USB cord to the RR-60 then your PC or MAC. I went to the website and downloaded the driver software. After a quick installation, I just place the document to be scanned into the front of the scanner and push the start button. The document is scanned.

What's nice is the scanner is thin and lightweight. Easy to carry along for scanning on the go. Perfect for receipts. EPSON makes the scanner solid and easy to use.

This Epson Rapid Receipt RR-60 portable wireless scanner is one of the easiest scanners I have ever used. Simple to install and immediately allows me to access my files, receipts, and most recently my tax returns. Scanning my files and being able to import them directly to my tax program was as simple as a push of a button.

I also use it to scan my receipts from retail stores to keep track of extended in-store warranties or product replacements. Great little scanner that basically helps simplify my life. I'm completely satisfied with the results of using this product. This is a review for the Rapid Receipt RR-60 Mobile Receipt Scanner that I received free of charge to do a beta test and review.

This handy portable scanner came just in time for tax season. I must say it has definitely met all my needs for my small business and super easy to install on my laptop even a child could do it. It is fast and very efficient when scanning receipts and other papers I need for filing my taxes and just basic up keep of my books for my business I highly recommend anyone who likes keeping everything on the computer please buy this and it stores away very neatly. This is a review for the rapid receipt rr-60 mobile receipt scanner that I received free of charge to do a beta test and review.

I'm reviewing the Epson RR-60 Rapid Receipt Portable Scanner. 

Wow, I've been looking for a portable scanner to take with me to school and work, and I found one. This little scanner is extremely light, and it's small enough to fit into a backpack. Another useful feature of this awesome scanner is it doesn't need an external power source for the power, so you don't need to carry a power adapter and worry about finding an electrical outlet to plug it into. It gets its power from the USB cord, so there is no need for a power adapter. 

The scanner is fast at scanning; it takes only about 5-6 seconds to scan a full page. The receipts are just as fast depending on how long of a receipt your scanning. If you have many receipts or a need for a portable scanning option, this is the scanner right for the job. The biggest plus for me is the lightweight, portable scanner I can take anywhere with me without the need for a power adapter.

“This is a review for the RapidReceipt RR-60 Mobile Receipt Scanner that I received free

Paired easily. It’s very light and stores compactly for all its varied positions. iPhone loads into the holder with greater ease than any I’ve had before. Tension is just right for a light duty tripod. I wouldn’t expect it to be steady in any wind but otherwise the build is good. The detachable remote is very handy away from the tripod and out of the way when attached. I’m happy.

This selfie stick is awkward. The capture button comes off- which I guess is a good idea if you want to use it as a tripod. However, if you’re trying to use it as a selfie stick, the button comes off the stick very easily. 
We went to Yosemite-tried to use this for the amazing views there, but it kept disconnecting from my Bluetooth in my phone. Quite disappointing for the cost.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The RapidReceipt™ RR-60 Mobile Receipt and Color Document Scanner is so great to have on hand. This thing is really nice! I have already scanned documents onto my computer using this. It is very easy to use. You do need to download the software to use it, but once you do that you are ready to go. Put your documents right in the scanner and push scan. Very simple to use. I also like that it comes with a software that can easily access where you do your taxes and upload documents to your tax software, that is so cool. It's nicely made, and it is not big, doesn't take up alot of space. Even scans in color, perfect for your everyday scanning! I would definitely recommend this thing is very perfect and useful! .

Difficult to find a good retractable iPhone holder/stand but the Joby TelePod (Model: JB01550) does the job. I needed something quick and found, for the price, it is a good value: lightweight and sturdy. I do recommend that if using as a stand, attach it to a 2.5 lb or more shot bag to prevent a strong wind from knocking it over. Currently, I use the JOBY TelePod to hold my Logitech - 4K Pro 4096 x 2160 Webcam (also purchased at Best Buy). As for the remote it does NOT stay attached to the handle at all, so I highly recommend you get a separate keychain ring and make it detachable. That way you can put in your pocket for remote picture and or video control. The holder clip for the phone is a pressure clamp and is okay. Not great and definitely not action shooting grade. If you want something for that, I recommend getting a Bower WA-TM100 360° Rotating Smartphone Tripod Mount – always good to have in your gear bag.

This is junk. It's slightly ironic that anyone could see different because it's designed to hold a $1k device. I wouldn't try to hold a $1 device with this. The gripping mechanism is extremely cheap and low quality. The "telescoping" rod retracts under the slightest pressure. I should have bought the $25 one if I wanted something this cut-rate and pathetic.

I think you should write a review when you are sure it is a genuine review. I bought it almost 2 years back and today while checking my old orders I found it. Thought of giving my feedback. It is the best product I ever bought. Bluetooth is still working perfectly fine, the battery is still in good shape. If you need a selfie stick, go for it.

Super fun dual use selfie stick - tripod w- remote
The cell phone holder that comes with it is only good for smaller lighter phones, recommend getting the heavy duty one with a lock from the same manufacturer - Doesn’t work with iphone 12 max pro in tripod mode - phone is too heavy, with lighter iPhone’s like iphone 12 and older no worries

I like the design but the phone holder is great, if you don't have a phone case on your phone, I find it strange these companies think people don't have a phone case. With a case on your phone, holder is not trustworthy. I like the rest of the product and I just replaced the phone holder part with a better holder.

I admittedly have not read the directions yet and tried to use it immediately. Connects to Bluetooth much better than my piece of junk dollar store selfie stick. I fear I will lose the attached button, it doesn't stay on the handle perfectly. I like that it doesn't need charging. I like that it's also a stand.

I purchased this stand to hold my phone while I stream opening packs of trading cards on stream for my friends, and yes, before you ask, I was super popular in high school and could do a push up. The stand works great, by the way. No shaking, holds the phone tight, and is easy to store!

This tripod does exactly as advertised, and holds my camera perfectly so I can take videos of myself because I look so great on camera. If you want to look as good as I (impossible) then I highly suggest you buy this. But make sure you get it from BestBuy.

This little thing works really well! I have never used a portable scanner before so I had no idea what to expect. What I got was an easy to use device that takes excellent scans. I bought this mostly for pictures, but is has scanned documents, racing bibs and pictures with excellent color reproduction.

I did install the software that was recommended, but technically I could have used the built in one for My MacBook Pro, but I’m glad I used the other one. It makes it easy to add additional pages to the same document. Overall, I would totally buy this again. It can’t do two sides at the same time, but that is not a big deal considering pictures were the primary reason. I wanted this scanner.

This scanner is a fantastic easy-to-use device for those who are committed to DIY projects rather than hiring professionals to do these tasks. I used this scanner to digitize my family's photo albums so that we had a digital archive that can be accessed anywhere. The quality is high enough that if I wanted to reprint any of these photos, there would not be a significant loss of quality. And the file sizes are not storage limit destroyers for wherever you choose to store the digital files. 

Once you get into a flow, the scanning process goes relatively quickly. The scanner does jam frequently but because of the size, all you have to do is pop it open and try again. If you don't rush it, it won't jam.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product for free from Brother in exchange for my honest opinion/review of the product. I found the scanner provided to me free of charge as a reviewer. I found the scanner quite reliable and helpful for my small business needs for scanning.  I was quite impressed with the portability factor of this item and the many quality functions as it has in solving my problems when it comes to daily scanning needs, whether they be high volume on low. I highly recommend this product and I found it greatly efficient to be able to pool my data and needs into one small portability scanner such as this one. I think this will be great addition to my os all business and we will be using it quite often.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have the DS-640 Compact Mobile Scanner, and It does provide a quality scan in both .jpg and .pdf; these are the file formats I have used it with. 
I have to use it with a USB connection so, I have found it works well when using my Laptop. It would have been better to truly make it "mobile" if it could be used with my mobile phone, this model cannot, It can be convenient for travel, or away from home or office scanners. Overall it works fine, the software is easy to set up, and it can scan a document very fast. If you desire a real "mobile" experience, you need to get the DS-940DW model. Also, I found the build to be excellent; it's solid but not bulky so that you can carry it with you and your Laptop.
Purchased this scanner to assist in my work from home and my personal use also. Best purchase ever, sleek, nice looking and works well. Would recommend this brand and item.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great scanner. The sheets feed easily and straight, colors and contract are accurate, text is sharp. The included software allows you to scan multiple pages into a single document, and you can download Brother's receipt scan software for free if you register your product. It's very lightweight and travels well.

The only two things that would have helped this are a micro-USB port instead of the larger one (one less cable to carry) and a small pouch to keep it from getting damaged when traveling.

Overall, an excellent scanner at a very reasonable price.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product for free from Brother in exchange for my honest opinion/review of the product. The first thing I noticed about the scanner was how small it was! It can easily fit in a backpack. While it was a bit of a struggle to install the drivers (through my own fault, not Brothers), once everything was up and running, I was pleasantly surprised by the print speed and quality, especially considering its size. My scanned pages came out clean and sharp, even though the paper I scanned initially was worn and wrinkled. I couldn`t be happier.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for at-home quick scanning of documents, receipts, pictures. Allows setup of multiple workflows for one-click scanning in a variety of formats - text, pdf, jpeg, etc. Also has a customizable machine default workflow so you can do quick scans with a press of the start button on the scanner. I use this scanner for receipts - they feed through easily and quickly, and set at the default 300 dpi the scans are quick and the images are sharp. This scanner is not wireless so it has to be connected to a laptop or desktop PC to work. The scanner is compact and lightweight so you could pack it in a bag with a laptop for on-the-go scanning, but the Brother wireless scanner for about $60 more might be a better choice if you need one for use on-the-road.

Recently purchased to convert all of my school files to digital copies. It jams easily, and suddenly today I received a message that says "memory full" when trying to scan in color. Yet, when I try to find how to clear the "memory" which I didn't know it supposedly had, there are no directions anywhere. The support site gives information for unrelated products. On top of that, the main driver won't load onto 2 different devices, so I have to pretend to let it be downloading just so I can use it at all. As the headline says...WHAT A JOKE!

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Brother DS-640 Compact Mobile Document Scanner 
Brother’s printer and scanner products never disappoint me. They seem to outlast my other equipment and work reliably. And, so again, I’m enjoying a portable scanner that was up and running only minutes after plugging it in and installing some software. No excuses, no problems. 

SETUP/INSTALL: Download the software. There are a couple of choices, and either works fine. There was a firmware update available, and that took moments to install, too. Plug in the printer and open the APP. You can select your Resolution (up to 600 x 600), File Type, color or B&W, size, and destination. Under advanced settings you can change brightness and contrast. Scanning is initiated from the App. Place the to-be-printed photo, paper, sketch into the front slot of the scanner, and initiate scanning from the APP. There is no auto-document feeder. While the scan is accomplished the image pops up in the App on your screen. 

PERFORMANCE: The scans are colorful, detailed and fast. Your selection of file type will determine what you will use to edit or enhance your scans (I use either Photo or Photoshop Elements --- NOT included). It’s all very straight forward. It’s hard to find fault with the scanner at all. It just works. 

I will remind other buyers that you should be sure you want a manual scanner. Brother has an autofeed version. It also has scanners that work with mobile devices. This model is intended to plug into the USB port of your laptop/desktop. I scan old photos and my grandkids artwork. I don’t care about auto-feed. My only “wish for” is that a nice carry case be included in the box. These wonderfully portable devices are not so portable if there is no protective carry case/shell/bag. 

But, I still like it a lot. It's easy to recommend Brother’s DS-640 scanner.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Yes. I'm an Android enthusiast. My Samsung S22 Ultra is a great phone, but I understand Apple gets a lot of the third party compatibility. Maybe that's due to the fragmentation of Android. Who knows? But I really don't appreciate companies that claim to be compatible with Android who are not truly compatible. This DJI Osmo Mobile 6 is a perfect example of that. Apple has an official app you can find in their app store, but Android is left with an APK (that my anti-virus program warned me about downloading) that needs to be side loaded. However, it still works for stabilizing, just don't think you'll be able to take advantage of all the zoom features and controlling options the stabilizer has. Luckily, I am mainly using it for family memories, so my Scorsese skills in film making will not need a lot of these controls. This is a solid and portable gimble, from its hardware to its mobile app! It has a slight learning curve but is very easy to grasp. 

You will have a wide range of stable and directional control for your videos/photos, and the extender arm and the tripod attachment make it a bonus for hitting those angles or those POV and selfie shots. 

I am also impressed with the thumb access to all of those buttons to trigger all of your iPhone's video and photo features without using the touchscreen. It is a very efficient and well-thought-out user experience. It would also be great if the trigger finger button could be customized as the video record or photo snapshot button.

My only gripe is the MagSafe clamp for iPhones using a protective case, as it could interfere with your buttons and continuously trigger them. It takes a little finesse, and it depends on your protective case, but you might be able to avoid it. Centering the MagSafe clamp is not difficult once you have done it a few times.

In some cases, you might need to offset the positioning of the clamp to avoid button triggering, which could also affect the gimble's auto-balancing feature in landscape mode. The gimble may also use more battery life to maintain its balance during landscape mode.

However, if you still have button/balancing issues with the DJI MagSafe clamp, I came across a perfect adapter mount if you Google "DJI magnetic ring holder phone clamp mount." It works perfectly with Magsafe iPhone cases and with the DJI Osmo 6 gimble!

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Stabilizer is one of the coolest products I’ve used in some time. Right out of the set up is super easy, scan the QR code to take you to the app store and download the DJI Mimo App and pair it via Bluetooth. Once in the app there are multiple tutorial videos that help you get familiar with the DJI Osmo Mobile 6, which is a nice feature to have so you're not having to Google or go on Youtube to learn how to properly use this device.  The metal mounting clip is one of the better mounts I have come across, in that it stretches wide enough to grasp around my Iphone 14 Pro Max with a case on, I was for sure thinking that my case was going to be too bulky for it but it was able to. The Mimo software is great in that it basically mimics my iPhone’s camera interface but with some more options on the screen depending on which setting you are in, such as in photo mode where there is a shutter timer where you can pick from 3 seconds, 5 seconds and 7 seconds. In the Video mode it allows you to pick the resolution (720P,1080P or 4K) and what frame rate you would like to shoot in, which is super nice being able to pick that right from the camera interface and not having to dive into the setting to find it. Then the most outstanding feature of the DJI Osmo Mobile 6 has to be the head tracking feature in that when shooting video, a green box shows up and the arm will literally move and follow your head as you move which is perfect for filming things such as content or family videos. The buttons on the DJI Osmo Mobile 6 are very intuitive in that you get a Zoom knob, a record button, a focus stick that allows you to move the arm like you would with the right stick on a game controller, and A landscape to vertical button. There is a trigger button on the back of the handle that is not as intuitive and I highly recommend watching all the tutorial videos to learn all of its little tricks. In summary I think this is one of the best filming accessories you can buy to truly get the best photos and videos on your cell phone.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The DJI Osmo Mobile 6  Gimbal is a very high quality, well designed mobile stabilizer.

But as an owner of the Google Pixel 6 I have to point out some of the negatives right from the start.

First, the DJI MIMO app is not available in the Google Play Store. In order to download the app you must go into settings and allow download and installation of apps from unknown sources. That’s right, you must download an app from a Chinese company directly, without being verified by Google. This of course is accompanied by a warning that downloading this app may cause harm to your device and other apps on your device.  Not very comforting. In addition, not all features work on Android phones. Each phone model is different and therefore this may vary by device.

Also, I found that my phone was hotter in the Osmo than it is normally when its in camera mode, and the battery drained much quicker.

One other issue is the magnetic clip holder. It goes on the Pixel phone on top of the volume switch. If placed exactly in the middle of the phone it presses on the down volume switch and turns the volume all the way down.

The focus scroll wheel is also not functional with my Pixel phone.

The device itself is very high quality, very ergonomically designed. It is very well balanced in the hand and does not cause hand fatigue. All buttons and switches are placed within easy reach.

DJI has videos in the app to fully explain the operation of each switch.

In the box you get the magnetic phone clip, the stabilizer unit, an attachable tripod and a charging cable.

After you download the app, the Osmo 6 will automatically turn on when you attach the phone and off when the phone is removed.

One of my favorite features is face lock while in video. Your phone will lock on your face and follow you around. You can place the phone in the Osmo with the tripod, put it on a flat surface and record yourself while moving, and the camera will follow you. A push of a button will automatically switch between portrait and landscape.

Image stabilization is of course a main reason for buying this device and it performs better than any phone by itself.

There is a scroll wheel for zooming in and out as well as a button for switching between video and photo.

There are way too many features to mention, however DJI does a great job of explaining the functions in video and with hints that appear on the screen.

I would love to recommend this device, and I would to any iPhone user. But if you are an Android user I would weigh the positives and negatives before purchasing. I don’t know why DJI has put Android users in this situation and I hope that this situation changes sooner rather than later. This could easily be a5 start review if not for the software issues for Android.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Osmo Mobile 6 is a very fun smartphone gimbal stabilizer packed with great features to help you capture smooth, creative footage and fun photos. I like that a lot of what the gimbal has to offer is right at my finger tips. Changing modes, camera orientation, and angles is a click of a button or a push of the joystick away from personal customization. Each mode focuses on customizing which axis has priority over the movement of the camera. More on the modes below.

DJI MIMO APP
To get the most out of the DJI Osmo Mobile 6, I suggest downloading the DJI Mimo app which allows you to use all the buttons to their fullest potential. Using the DJI Mimo app will unlock these additional button or handle features:
Switch between front and back camera
Switch between photo and video mode
Use the focusing or zoom wheel
Use the record button

The features listed above are not available to use with my Google Pixel Camera App. Here are the Osmo Mobile 6 buttons or handle features you can use WITHOUT the Mimo app (say like with your phone’s native camera app, these will just inherently work if the gimbal is on and the phone is mounted properly): 
Joystick
Switching between Landscape or Portrait orientation
Changing Modes
Re-centering with trigger button
Using the trigger to “lock” the view

The DJI Mimo app is very neat. I really like the subject-follow feature because it essentially allows you to set the camera down and let the app/camera follow your movement even without handling the gimbal itself. This is possible with the included mountable tripod which is an awesome accessory that’s included with this kit. My phone is not compatible with the focusing feature so the wheel on the side only allows me to zoom, not smoothly I might add, but not a dealbreaker.

EXTENDING FEATURE
This gimbal also extends so you can get high up drone-like shots or very low shots. It’s like a selfie stick, but better because it’s also a gimbal! The only downside to this is that because of the extendable feature, you have to be careful when taking it to amusement parks as they often don’t allow extendable devices like this one.

4 GIMBAL MODES
Out of the 4 modes, the one that’s more “general” or easiest to work with is the first one: Follow mode. It’s going to either pan up or down, left or right, depending on which way you move the camera, and it won’t “roll” sideways. 

The second mode: Tilt Lock, will do just that, lock the tilt and allow you to pan left or right with natural hand movement. If you want to change the angle of the tilt in Tilt Lock mode, just use the joystick to bring the camera’s view up or down. 

The third mode: FPV will actually follow any movement on all 3 axes, so you get more dynamic or creative shots with this mode as it will “roll” (turn the camera sideways) as you’re following a subject. 

The fourth mode: SpinShot allows you to naturally “roll” the camera sideways while still facing a subject, as well as lets the joystick rotate the camera as well, whereas in the other modes, the joystick is moving the camera angle up, down, left or right. SpinShot allows the camera to tilt sideways. To get a visual of what this looks like, look straight ahead then lean your head to one side like you’re putting your ear to your shoulder, and keep looking straight. This is the “roll” effect I’m talking about.

OVERALL
I love playing with this gimbal. I take it to local music shows and plan to take it to a festival to get some smooth footage and fun pictures. It’s great for people who like to film videos whether it’s for an event or an artistic video piece. This gimbal has plenty of modes to work with to get super creative shots or just get nicely stable footage. I’ve only had to charge it once so far and I’ve used it a few times. There’s a nice indicator screen that shows you modes, battery level, and will let you know with a red light above the battery indicator if the magnet is not secured properly. I can definitely recommend this gimbal to anyone who likes video tech or looking to gift it.
